newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end weaker in listless trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end weaker in listless trade.

text.p: The Singapore stock market closed on Friday down slightly in listless trade with foreign shares traded up, dealers said.
The Straits Times Industrial Index at noon was down 4.2 points to 2,064.52 points.

Debut Labroy Marine closed up Singapore 14 cents from its share IPO price of S$0.69 on volume of 20.86 million shares. The counter opened to trade flat and fell to a low S$0.675 before picking up in the afternoon. It hit a day high of S$0.86.
"Labroy was sold short in the morning and there was some covering in the afternoon," one dealer said.
Foreign shares rose on technical rebound from Thursday's falls. The Business Times Singapore Regional Index (SRI) was up 5.66 points or 0.58 percent to 981.96 points.
Creative Technology, SIA foreign, Fraser & Neave and City Development headed the losers, all down 20 cents. SPH foreign headed the gainers, up 30 cents.
Overall volume was up at 120.49 million shares traded with gainers ahead of losers 197 to 117.
